I've just come back from Iraq I was
there about two weeks ago my own view is
that the various timelines of getting
the United States out of City Say by
this summer ceasing all combat
operations by a year from this summer
and beginning all U.S forces out of Iraq
over the next two and a half or so years
I believe that there's no way those
timelines can be met and have Iraq not
once again really descend into a lot
more disorder
I simply do not believe that Iraq the
Iraqi police and military forces will be
able and willing to take on
those kinds of responsibilities I don't
believe what the Iraqi
Iraqi Society has reached a point
where it can be a self-sustaining
orderly place without American forces
there so my My Hope and my prediction is
that sometime after next January's Iraqi
national elections the new Iraqi prime
minister and the president of the United
States are going to have to work out
a new Arrangement where essentially the
reductions or drawdowns in U.S forces
will move more slowly and secondly we
will keep some kind of residual force in
Iraq that where there will not be a
withdrawal but my view is if we stick
slavishly or automatically to these
timelines I don't believe Iraq would be
ready for for the responsibilities that
it would inherit if and when we left
well not exactly the surge which really
consisted of several pieces there was
the increase in U.S combat forces there
was the change in strategy which is

and it showed where a large outside

the counter Insurgency could make a real

I thought uh it was you know in

probably the best we can hope for with
Iraq is a somewhat messy future not a

and my view is that the best way to keep

okay
is probably by keeping a residual

the problem is that he faces an

they've obviously already produced a

if they were to put it back in their

the the raw material for a nuclear

can match the pace of Technology

but I think he's he's right to try this

ceiling on the Iranian program one that

alternatives are not attractive the idea

because it's not clear what it would

expensive ways
it's all it also would drive the price

and as bad as the Middle East is Right
today one can imagine a situation that

over the next 25 years had nuclear

negotiate

we could talk about the amount of

the difference with the Bush
